intro: Artemisia lactiflora var. taibaishanensis, commonly known as the Taibaishan Artemisia, is a perennial shrub native to high-altitude regions of China. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flower heads that appear in late summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in alpine or subalpine environments. Its essential oils contain compounds with potential medicinal properties, including antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory effects. This variant is of particular interest in botanical studies due to its unique ecological adaptations and chemical composition.
